meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be retrieved.
meanings.sent1: The retrievability of the lost toy made the child happy.
meanings.sent2: The retrievability of the document on the computer was impressive.
meanings.sent3: The retrievability of the remote control was like a magic trick.
meanings.sent4: Her memory had the retrievability of a well-organized library.
meanings.sent5: The retrievability of the key in the dark room was crucial for finding the exit.

meanings.definition: The ease with which something can be found or recovered.
meanings.sent1: The retrievability of the book on the shelf was convenient.
meanings.sent2: The retrievability of the lost phone was a relief.
meanings.sent3: The retrievability of the missing sock was a mystery.
meanings.sent4: His voice had the retrievability of a familiar song.
meanings.sent5: The retrievability of the recipe saved dinner from disaster.
